content:
Hello!
I just wanted to briefly thank everyone in here for helping me with all my endeavors creating the project i just released: https://github.com/RDambrosio016/Rust-CUDA

I could not have done it without your help, especially @bjorn3 and @nagisa who helped tremendously with debugging and answering random rustc questions :heart:

Wow, this is a super impressive amount of work done in just over a month:

image.png

Kudos!

Ben Reeves said:

Wow, this is a super impressive amount of work done in just over a month:

Productivity!

Kudos @Riccardo D'Ambrosio
It was actually about ~6 months, i did a lot of work before making a github repo

The timeframe-impressiveness must be degraded and is now in the "humanly possible if very very good" category instead of "superior-plane-of-existence" category. :P

On a more serious note, the work as a whole is very impressive and I'm looking forward to check that out in depth this weekend.

Thanks :big_smile:
The hardest part has been the LLVM stuff, because the codegen needs to build a C++ shim first, and that causes all kinds of pain. In the future ill probably ship the shim as a prebuilt library and download it from CI. downloading CI LLVM has also been such a pain

Very neat project; congrats!

And it's (in part) a rustc codegen backend? Kudos also to all the compiler folks who've been making that a reasonable option for people to experiment with!

Absolutely, i think custom codegen backends will only keep becoming more popular, we have like what... 5 total backends at this point? I think a challenging aspect will be figuring out how to not require the sort of hacky workaround of cuda_builder
now dont mind me just going to submit a pr to make get_param take &mut self because im sure using a mutex on the llvm builder is less than ideal for performance :upside_down:

and its totally not because im actually lying to rustc about certain function signature types like silently remapping i128 to <2 x i64> because libnvvm segfaults if you do that...

nope nothing like that going on here
